title: Effective Comparison and Application Strategies for Face-to-Face Learning vs. Online Synchronous Discussions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic discussion skills and experience with digital platforms
context.additional_context: Social sector job training for advanced professionals in managerial/leadership roles, conducted in smartphone-centric constrained environments with a focus on formative assessment.

learning_goals: Students can explain at least three key differences between face-to-face and online discussion environments.
Students can systematically evaluate discussion data using content analysis techniques.
Students can propose at least two strategies to improve online discussion environments based on survey results.
Students can apply instructional design strategies for facilitating in-depth discussions to real-world cases.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
